intro: Physanthemum glaucum, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a waxy, bluish-green surface. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Physanthemum glaucum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
